verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, Keep ye judgment, and do justice: for my salvation is near to come, and my righteousness to be revealed.
verses.web: LORD says, “Maintain justice and do what is right, for my salvation is near and my righteousness will soon be revealed.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Do what is just and right, because my salvation is coming soon and my righteousness is about to be revealed."

verses.kjv: Blessed is the man that doeth this, and the son of man that layeth hold on it; that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and keepeth his hand from doing any evil.
verses.web: Blessed is the man who does this, and the son of man who holds it fast; who keeps the Sabbath without profaning it and keeps his hand from doing any evil.”
verses.ct: "Blessed is the person who does this and holds firmly to it — who honors the Sabbath and doesn't defile it, and who keeps his hands from doing any evil."

verses.kjv: Neither let the son of the stranger, that hath joined himself to the LORD, speak, saying, The LORD hath utterly separated me from his people: neither let the eunuch say, Behold, I am a dry tree.
verses.web: Let no foreigner who has joined himself to LORD speak, saying, “LORD will surely separate me from his people.” Do not let the eunuch say, “Behold, I am a dry tree.”
verses.ct: No foreigner who has committed himself to the LORD should say, "The LORD will certainly exclude me from his people." And no eunuch should say, "I'm nothing but a dry tree."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD unto the eunuchs that keep my sabbaths, and choose the things that please me, and take hold of my covenant;
verses.web: For LORD says, “To the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, choose the things that please me, and hold fast to my covenant,
verses.ct: For the LORD says this to the eunuchs who honor my Sabbaths, who choose what pleases me, and who hold fast to my covenant:

verses.kjv: Even unto them will I give in mine house and within my walls a place and a name better than of sons and of daughters: I will give them an everlasting name, that shall not be cut off.
verses.web: I will give them in my house and within my walls a memorial and a name better than of sons and of daughters. I will give them an everlasting name that will not be cut off.
verses.ct: "I will give them a place in my house and within my walls — a memorial and a name better than sons and daughters could give them. I will give them an everlasting name that will never be cut off."

verses.kjv: Also the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the LORD, to serve him, and to love the name of the LORD, to be his servants, every one that keepeth the sabbath from polluting it, and taketh hold of my covenant;
verses.web: Also the foreigners who join themselves to LORD to serve him, and to love LORD’s name, to be his servants, everyone who keeps the Sabbath from profaning it, and holds fast my covenant,
verses.ct: "And the foreigners who commit themselves to the LORD, who serve him and love the name of the LORD, who become his servants — everyone who honors the Sabbath and doesn't defile it, and who holds fast to my covenant —"

verses.kjv: Even them will I bring to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer: their burnt offerings and their sacrifices shall be accepted upon mine altar; for mine house shall be called an house of prayer for all people.
verses.web: I will bring these to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be accepted on my altar; for my house will be called a house of prayer for all peoples.”
verses.ct: "I will bring them to my holy mountain and fill them with joy in my house of prayer. Their burnt offerings and sacrifices will be accepted on my altar, because my house will be called a house of prayer for all peoples."

verses.kjv: The Lord GOD, which gathereth the outcasts of Israel saith, Yet will I gather others to him, beside those that are gathered unto him.
verses.web: The Lord LORD, who gathers the outcasts of Israel, says, “I will yet gather others to him, in addition to his own who are gathered.”
verses.ct: The Lord GOD, who gathers the outcasts of Israel, declares, "I will gather still others to him beyond those already gathered."

verses.kjv: All ye beasts of the field, come to devour, yea, all ye beasts in the forest.
verses.web: All you animals of the field, come to devour, all you animals in the forest.
verses.ct: Come, all you wild animals of the field! Come, all you beasts of the forest — come and devour!

verses.kjv: His watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant, they are all dumb dogs, they cannot bark; sleeping, lying down, loving to slumber.
verses.web: His watchmen are blind. They are all without knowledge. They are all mute dogs. They can’t bark— dreaming, lying down, loving to slumber.
verses.ct: Israel's watchmen are blind, every one of them. They know nothing. They are like mute dogs that can't even bark — lying around, stretched out, loving their sleep.

verses.kjv: Yea, they are greedy dogs which can never have enough, and they are shepherds that cannot understand: they all look to their own way, every one for his gain, from his quarter.
verses.web: Yes, the dogs are greedy. They can never have enough. They are shepherds who can’t understand. They have all turned to their own way, each one to his gain, from every quarter.
verses.ct: These dogs have greedy appetites that are never satisfied. They are shepherds with no understanding. Every one of them has turned to his own path, each one chasing his own profit from every direction.

verses.kjv: Come ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as this day, and much more abundant.
verses.web: “Come,” say they, “I will get wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and tomorrow will be as today, great beyond measure.”
verses.ct: "Come," they say, "let me get some wine! Let's drink ourselves full of strong drink! Tomorrow will be just like today — or even better!"
